means: 节略( abridge的过去式和过去分词 )
<古>剥夺（某人的）权利（或特权等）

sentence.Network_en: The rights of citizens must not be abridged without proper cause.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有正当理由,不能擅自剥夺公民的权利.

sentence.Network_en: The play was abridged for TV.
sentence.Network_cn: 剧本经过节略,以拍摄电视片.
这篇小说必须加以删减.

entry.def: An abridged book or play has been made shorter by removing some parts of it.

example.ex: This is an abridged version of her new novel 'The Queen and I'.
example.tran: 这是她的新小说《我与女王》的删节本。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of texts) shortened by condensing or rewriting;

auth_sentence.content: Watch abridged moments from some of those films here.
auth_sentence.res_content: Watch abridged moments from some of those films here.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Watch abridged moments from some of those films here.

auth_sentence.content: No abridged novel by Greene ever made it to publication.
auth_sentence.res_content: No abridged novel by Greene ever made it to publication.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No abridged novel by Greene ever made it to publication.

auth_sentence.content: The faculty of the present proprietor to entertain his friends is greatly abridged,...the will...remains the same.
